segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, stretching to grab cookies from the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He looks so determined, balancing on that wobbly stool like it’s nothing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is about to tip, and he doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is waiting below, ready to catch whatever he drops.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at how sneaky they are, but it’s also a little dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying dishes has no idea what’s happening right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ll get away with it or if she’ll turn around and catch them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water on the floor is spreading, and they’re standing right in the middle of it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re going to regret this if someone slips and falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a little adventure for them, but it could end badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they’re careful, but kids never think about the risks, do they?
segments.speaker: PAR
